page.title: 18The Enviroment 1
page.content: Most of the land in our area is farming land.In the Towy valley there aren't many trees,but the land is quite flat and is good for farming.The farmers mostly use the land for growing grasses for the cows to graze on.Up here near the school there are more trees and the fields are steeper. Most of the trees are decidious oak trees,there are a few sycamore,beech, ash and firn trees about,but not many. Round the Towy valley and here the cows are used for milking.Up on the Garn most of the cows are used for beef.The soil up on the Garn is poor, and there is not much grass.Up there mostly there is bracken and other types of ferns and low grasses.There are hardly any trees on the Garn because the soil is so poor and windswept.Sheep are bred on mostly mountain slopes.
